content:
You've got a great plan! The Willis Tower (formerly Sears Tower) is an iconic Chicago landmark, and the views from the Skydeck on the 103rd floor are simply breathtaking. Be prepared for a thrilling experience when you step out onto the Ledge, a glass balcony that extends 4.3 feet outside the building!

A stroll along the Magnificent Mile (Michigan Avenue) is a must-do in Chicago. You'll find upscale boutiques, restaurants, and iconic landmarks like the Tribune Tower and Water Tower Place. Don't miss the beautiful architecture and lively atmosphere.

Navy Pier is a fantastic spot to spend an afternoon. You can take a boat tour of Lake Michigan, which offers stunning views of the city skyline. If you're interested in exploring the pier itself, you can visit the Polk Bros Park and Lake Point Tower, which offer great views of the city and the lake. If you're traveling with kids, they might enjoy the Navy Pier Park, which features an amusement park with a Ferris wheel and other rides.

For your boat tour, I recommend considering the Chicago Architecture River Cruise. It's a 90-minute tour that takes you along the Chicago River and provides a unique perspective on the city's iconic architecture. You'll learn about the history and design of many famous buildings, and it's a great way to see the city from a different angle.

If you have time, consider visiting the nearby Millennium Park, which is within walking distance of Navy Pier. You can take a stroll through the beautiful Lurie Garden, snap photos in front of the "Cloud Gate" sculpture (The Bean), and enjoy the free outdoor concerts and events that take place throughout the summer.

How does that sound? Have any other questions or areas you'd like to explore during your trip?
